doc.previous: With his power Mswati greatly reduced the influence of the Emakhandzambili while incorporating more people into his kingdom either through conquest or by giving them refuge These later arrivals became known to the Swazis as Emafikamuva The clans who accompanied the Dlamini kings were known as the Bemdzabuko or true Swazi
doc.after: The autonomy of the Swaziland nation was influenced by British and Dutch rule of southern Africa in the 19th and early 20th centuries In 1881 the British government signed a convention recognising Swazi independence despite the Scramble for Africa that was taking place at the time This independence was also recognised in the convention of 1884
